title: Part (b)
stimulusHtml:

The two criteria in part B are achieved independently.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include either of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that domestic consumers of wheat in Grainland will benefit and/or does not explain that with trade the price of wheat will fall down to the world price, increasing the total consumer surplus. [Note that domestic producers will not benefit because they will be producing less wheat as a result of the lower price.]

The response states that domestic consumers of wheat in Grainland will benefit because with trade the price of wheat will fall down to the world price, increasing the total consumer surplus. [Note that domestic producers will not benefit because they will be producing less wheat as a result of the lower price.]

title: Part (d)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not show a rightward shift of the supply curve on the graph in part (d) sufficient enough to eliminate imports of wheat as shown in the graph below.
